rule.name: More than one exit statement for this loop
rule.description:
More than one exit statement for this loop.

Used when there is more than one possible exit statement for a loop (either break or return statements).

rule.name: Too many decorators for this function
rule.description:
Too many decorators for this function (%s/%s).

Used when too many decorators are applied on a function.

rule.name: Exit condition based on equality or difference
rule.description:
Exit condition based on equality or difference.

Used when the exit condition of a loop uses an equality or a difference comparison.

rule.name: An attribute is named after a built-in, consider renaming it
rule.description:
%s is named after a built-in, consider renaming it.

Used when an attribute or a method is named after a built-in. This makes the code more difficult to read.

rule.name: Consider not using recursion
rule.description:
Consider not using recursion.

Used when direct recursion is used in a function or a method. It can lead to a dangerous behaviour if the depth is not known.

rule.name: Consider within a context manager
rule.description:
Consider %s within a context manager.

Used when a file is opened or a lock is acquired without context manager. This is error-prone because one can forget closing or releasing it.

rule.name: Too few comments
rule.description:
Too few comments (%s/%s %%).

Used the ratio (comments+docstrings)/code_lines is insufficient for a function or a module.

rule.name: Too high cyclomatic complexity (mccabe)
rule.description:
Too high cyclomatic complexity (mccabe %d/%d).

Used when the McCabe cyclomatic number is too high for a function or a method.

rule.name: Too high cyclomatic complexity (simplified mccabe)
rule.description:
Too high cyclomatic complexity (simplified mccabe %d/%d).

Used when the simplified McCabe cyclomatic number is too high for a function or a method.

rule.name: Missing field from docstring
rule.description:
"%s" field missing from %s docstring.

Used when an expected field is not present in the docstring of a module, class, function or method.

rule.name: Malformed field in docstring
rule.description:
Malformed "%s" field in %s docstring.

Used when an expected field is not present in the docstring of a module, class, function or method.

rule.name: Description missing in docstring
rule.description:
Description missing in %s docstring.

Used when no description exists for a docstring.

rule.name: Consider dropping use of sys.exit()
rule.description:
Consider dropping use of sys.exit().

Used when a call to sys.exit() is made out of __main__ scope.

rule.name: Consider dropping use of os.XXX
rule.description:
Consider dropping use of os.%s.

Used when environment variables are accessed. A program should not rely on its execution environment.

rule.name: Consider using argparse module instead of sys.argv
rule.description:
Consider using argparse module instead of sys.argv.

Used when command line arguments are read from sys.argv instead of using argparse module.
